fields.description:
PLEASE REMOVE YOUR SPYWARE FROM MY COMPUTER. I DID NOT CHOOSE TO DOWNLOAD IT.. YOU DOWNLOADED THIS SHIT WITHOUT MY CONSENT WITH OTHER SOFTWARE, AND YOU ARE FUCKING UP MY COMPUTER. I AM TELLING ALL YOUR CLIENTS ABOUT THIS\\
FUCK YOU BASTARDS!!!!!
fields.summary: your uninstalling instruction do not work

fields.description:
I've been a bitbucket user for about a year, switch over from github.  One thing that has always bothered me about your service(and one of the very few I might add) is the access management -> user/email address auto complete.  It's very difficult to find the user because often I know the first name last name but not the actual username.  Typing in the users F L name does not auto complete the user correct or even come close.  This makes it difficult to add users to the repo access.

Personally I think the autocomplete should provide a dropdown of all users that are currently have access to any of your repos.  First Name/Last name search also needs to improve.  Or maybe just a page with a list of users along with their username for the account?  IDK, but I do know what you've got there doesn't work too well.
fields.summary: Access Management issues

fields.description:
I have configured a post service hook to pull the repo to update my site, but the service hook does not seem to execute.

If I manually load the URL into my browser, I have expected results.

The first line of the script sends an email to myself for verification, and unfortunately I never receive this automated email.

This gives me reason to believe the hook is never executed.
fields.summary: POST service hooks don't seem to execute

fields.description:
(This was a comment on BCLOUD-2380, but seems like - though related - is a UI and general process issue)

Here is a concrete example of a useful community process hook, by way of a specific example from a UI element from github.com, and how it is being used.

In my context,  people would prefer to use hg to git, and the generality of this seems so broad that I bring it to your attention.

The feature is "Edit" button / option when viewing any file of any arbitrary repository. The action of that "Edit" button would be "fork this repository", so that you instantiate a fork-followed-by-edit on your fork.

To see how this is useful, have a look, for example, at the following document from UMich:

https://khmer.readthedocs.org

*Note* the yellow "edit this document" in the lower right. Click, and follow the top link (to the source for that particular page; works with any arbitrary page, linking back to the correct source page in the repository);

NOTE: github.com has a UI element "Edit" - *hover* over it.

NOW: Forking is up to the user who would like to make an edit / correction.  If a user doesn't have a bitbucket account, a path to creating one would be provided.

This has the effect of facilitating a process, and encouraging community participation.

I think this general "EDIT" on any given file, with such an associated action path would be most useful.

Thanks!
fields.summary: UI support to edit any file, resulting in a fork

fields.description:
Currently the blame button only annotates lines with the latest changeset info where it was changed. But often enough I find that I want to browse the evolution of some line and thus am forced to manually go back in time through commits pressing blame again and again.

It would be nice if by some means I could quickly view all the commits some particular line was changed in and browse into them.
fields.summary: View all commits a line has been changed in

fields.description:
Hi.

I have connectet GitHub account, but on inport page (https://bitbucket.org/repo/import) BitBucket want username and password from me.

Its not a problem of course. But maybe separate Git and GitHub from "Source" option if GitHub account was connected?
fields.summary: Import from GitHub (BB-7275)

fields.description: Case: I'd like to have an option to only see team members in autocomplete when writing a comment with @ mention. Suppose I only need to work on couple certain repos in a team. It feels like I have a chance of accidentally ping an outside user.
fields.summary: Show only team members in autocomplete

fields.description: I can't remember my password so I tried to reset it. I get the email and I click on the link, but it gives me a 404 Dead Link error. This is a huge problem because I'm on a tight deadline and I need to log in so I can add a developer to the account. After it didn't work the first time, I tried again and it sent me another email - same result.
fields.summary: 404 Dead link when I click email link to reset my password

fields.description:
# I forked a repo that hasn't yet had a commit.
# cloned and pushed to my account.
# Tried to create a pull request but I get an endless progress wheel and javascript error "cannot call method 'split' of null. The source is minified, but I think the issue is the right hand pane is trying to populate the branches of the parent repo but doesn't find anything due to lack of initial commit.

Not a big deal but a bit puzzling until I figured out the issue.
fields.summary: Create pull screen breaks if originator has no commits (BB-7276)

fields.description: Why there is no support for RTL languages in wiki?
fields.summary: RTL support in Wiki (BB-7286)

fields.description: Similar to other services, Bitibucket should offer a way to scope an OAuth permission for a user so that the developer can request access to only profile information or repositories etc.
fields.summary: Offer granular control of OAuth permissions to developers via scopes (BB-7264)
Stuck in creating repository screen

fields.description:
This call is not working. I am making the following request:

**https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/privileges/latinojoel/assar-chouricas/R_Peres\\
**\\
I know that I have permissions (admin) on the repository, but It will only return:

[] (empty array)

Another example, If I try to get my privileges like this:

https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/privileges/r_peres

(meanwhile it was changed)

Although I have read permission on the same repo (assar-chouricas) it won't show me that on the list.
fields.summary: GET a list of user privileges granted on a repository

fields.description: Since wikis are repositories in themselves, it would be possible and rather nice to have the same services integration as for other repositories (e.g. post wiki change notifications somewhere).
fields.summary: services for wikis

fields.description: https://secure.simplistix.co.uk/svn/Simplistix/execute/?p=4400 is not recognized as a valid SVN url, though this is the SVN 1.6 way to point to a rev
fields.summary: Cannot import SVN repo with a pegged rev (BB-7285)

fields.description:
I'm importing an SVN repository. Entered all data needed, url, login, password etc.\\
The import hangs and it is in the same state for more than 24h.
fields.summary: Import repository from SVN hangs up

fields.description:
when i create an issue or comment on one an email gets send to all concerned users including me!!! meaning, when i do an action on the site it should not send me an email to notify me that i did that.\\
I hope this clear enough.\\
Thanks.
fields.summary: notification sent to the wrong person

fields.description:
We have quite a lot of repositories for a lot of small stuff we have developed with our team.\\
I'm lucky to have found a way to allow the entire development group write access when a repository is created, however, I would also like to add a service by default when creating a new repository.

Would it be possible to implement this?
fields.summary: Allow services to be defined by default when creating repository

fields.description: When you click 'approve' some commit, approve/ unapprove button work fine. But when you  will have reloaded the page, this button again will be in 'approve' state even if commit already approved.
fields.summary: Commit approve/unapprove feature (BB-7258)

fields.description: Need a way to save issue tracker filter/search parameters. I want to be able to see issues assigned to me, that are open and in priority order.
fields.summary: Issue Tracker Listing Enhancement

fields.description:
I was performing a push to one of my bitbucket repositories, and got the following stack trace. In the end, it does appear that the push completed successfully, but I thought I should report this stack trace in case it's a bug you haven't seen before.

This was the commit I was pushing:\\
https://bitbucket.org/invenshure/ec2-utility-scripts/commits/79f8d347bea436eac411e1a0687708d2

I've attached the stack trace.

Thanks!\\
-Erik Anderson

I was pushing from my dev environment and everything appeared on the server, and the push was correct but I got a weird hook py error. I've attached it as bitbuckethookError.txt

Everything worked, i re-pushed and didn't get any errors or anything, so just letting you know since your nice enough to give us awesome hosting.

fields.summary: unpleasant-looking error message on pushing a new remote branch

fields.description:
Hi,

We are currently experiencing an issue with a POST service not being called when a user new changeset is pushed on your service.\\
After multiple trial, i come to the conclusion it only produce the issue while pushing with the ssh protocol, not the https.

I don't know if it is related, but i have an error message at the end of the ssh-push\\
pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/weare/sandbox\\
searching for changes\\
remote: adding changesets\\
remote: adding manifests\\
remote: adding file changes\\
remote: added 4 changesets with 4 changes to 2 files\\
remote: bb/acl: ahsx is allowed. accepted payload.\\
remote: error: changegroup.last_updated hook raised an exception: exception() got an unexpected keyword argument 'exc_info'

A.
fields.summary: Service not called on ssh push

fields.description:
{code}
#!python

remote: bb/acl: phonkee is allowed. accepted payload.
remote: Traceback (most recent call last):
remote:   File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/scripts/git/hooks/post-receive", line 16, in <module>
remote:     sys.exit(posthooks.githooks())
remote:   File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/orochi/git.py", line 1537, in wrapper
remote:     delnodes, disabled=disabled)
remote:   File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/orochi/hooks.py", line 61, in _runhooks
remote:     _logerror(repo.path, sys.exc_info(), repo._cfg['logger'])
remote:   File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/orochi/hooks.py", line 31, in _logerror

remote: TypeError: exception() got an unexpected keyword argument 'extra'

{code}
fields.summary: Post hook error (git)

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I've had bitbucket -> hipchat notifications setup for a while and working fine, however, when I try to push to a repo that has these notifications setup this happens:

1).  No notification to the hipchat room (previously working integrations, correct room id and api token).

2).  CLI errors like so:\\
mhill@bookdoc:/var/www/vm-server$ git push origin classic-nation\\
Counting objects: 5, done.\\
Delta compression using up to 4 threads.\\
Compressing objects: 100% (2/2), done.\\
Writing objects: 100% (3/3), 316 bytes, done.\\
Total 3 (delta 1), reused 0 (delta 0)\\
remote: bb/acl: mikeyhill is allowed. accepted payload.\\
remote: Traceback (most recent call last):\\
remote:   File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/scripts/git/hooks/post-receive", line 16, in <module>\\
remote:     sys.exit(posthooks.githooks())\\
remote:   File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/orochi/git.py", line 1537, in wrapper\\
remote:     delnodes, disabled=disabled)\\
remote:   File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/orochi/hooks.py", line 61, in _runhooks\\
remote:     _logerror(repo.path, sys.exc_info(), repo._cfg['logger'])\\
remote:   File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/orochi/hooks.py", line 31, in _logerror\\
remote:     logger.exception(message, exc_info=exc_info)\\
remote: TypeError: exception() got an unexpected keyword argument 'exc_info'\\
To git@bitbucket.org:vaildevops/vm-server.git\\
ad2b70e..bdfbcfc  classic-nation -> classic-nation

Would like to get this working so my fellow programmers can get their notifications.

Thanks,\\
Michael H.
fields.summary: Hipchat notifications causing errors

fields.description: Not sure when this started, but they are no longer working - nothing is getting cross-referenced, and tickets aren't closing when I send 'fixes BCLOUD-123'.
fields.summary: commit ticket references (close/refs/etc) not working
[deleted]

fields.description:
I would like issue emails to go to different email addresses I have based on the repository the issue is in. Someone else asked for the same feature as a comment on this page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Setting+Email+Preferences.

Possibly this is related to https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/4213 (Improve notification options).
fields.summary: Allow notification address to be specified per-repository
There is a whitespace after the Python version in the footer

Some how my repository home page\\
https://bitbucket.org/danodonovan/.dotfiles\\
is throwing a 500 error. I can check in / check out over SSH without issue.

Quote

"Something went wrong.

You can contact support or create a public issue if the problem persists.\\
This might be useful in debugging the problem:\\
ab152e4d15244e1b95646b7ae5937409$e589b9d5d4e425ecaedad2a68717f5d8\\
You can also visit our status page."

fields.description:
I had a POST service setup and working yesterday just fine. I noticed today that it had stopped functioning so completed the following tests;

Changed URL to a different server and watched access log - no access recorded.\\
Changed to Posttestserver.com - nothing recorded.\\
Added twitter service with my personal account authorised - nothing recorded.\\
Tried another repository POST service to no avail.

Each time I added or edited a file.\\
git add file\\
git commit -m 'test'\\
git push.

The Push seems to be working just fine on the web interface, just no POST service.
fields.summary: POST/Services not working

fields.summary: Notifications not showing in hipchat

Could you please fix this?

Kind regards,\\
Tjerk Ameel

I think this would be a neat feature to implement.

Hi,

The POST service does not seem to be working.

I currently have 2 POSTs setup on my repo's. One is for JIRA to link the issues to the commits and the other fires to a remote server to trigger a build on Jenkins.\\
Neither of these are currently working.\\
This is for JIRA on the Atlassian servers. I have not made any changes to my server or JIRA.\\
Please can you investigate.

Regards

Adam Richardson

fields.description:
Hi, we have a problem pulling from our repositiry. It started after one colleague pushed his changes.

We got abort: stream ended unexpectedly (got 79599 bytes, expected 82008) and log

{code}
#!python

pulling from ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/twobits/whichairline
searching for changes
all local heads known remotely
adding changesets
adding manifests
adding file changes
transaction abort!
rollback completed

[command returned code 255 Mon Jan 21 17:21:54 2013]

whichairline%
{code}

Is it possible to fix repo directly on bitbucket?

Turkish character is being converted as - character but it should be like\\
ı or İ = i\\
ğ or Ğ = g\\
ü or Ü = u\\
ş or Ş = s\\
ö or Ö = o\\
ç or Ç = c

thanks...
fields.summary: URL encoding of certain characters could be better (BB-7250)

fields.description:
Hi,

my problem has been described here in pretty detail (in the comments):\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Using+a+Bitbucket+Wiki

"_I can't see the wiki pages I create after pressing Home. How do I list all my wiki pages?_"

"_The best way to do this is to clone the Wiki and work with it on your local drive.  See the section Updating your wiki pages above._"

"_(apologies in advance for bad language)\\
Seriously, wake the fuck up.\\
You need to be able to view all the pages you have created online. This is 2012. I can edit, build and deploy applications online. I certainly expect a company the understands wikis to grok this.\\
It does NOT make sense to have work locally on a wiki just to see the pages I wrote\\
It is not "wrong" or "unwiki" to be able to see your pages\\
This is not a side issue, or an enhancement\\
Please just start by implementing /wiki/pages in a simple RESTian fashion and go from there._"

Can you do anything about it?\\
BTW bitbucket is great! :)

Thanks,\\
Viktor
fields.summary: CAnnot see the created Wiki page...

fields.description:
Issues created via REST API don't trigger notifications and don't show up in project's newsfeed.

I'm using /1.0/repositories/frantic/wather-info/issues REST endpoint. Issue is created successfully, but no email/internal messages are sent. Also new issue doesn't show up in news feed.
fields.summary: Issues created via REST API don't trigger notifications (BB-7261)

fields.description:
Hello,\\
I have just switched over some of my repos from github and have noticed a few strange things. Of note, this repo should be 100% private.

# https://bitbucket.org/scgbitbucket/kernel-cfid3 is showing recent activity that has nothing to do with my private repo, and is quite far from 'recent'. I am concerned about code privacy given strange users are showing up in my history.
# The size of this repo shows as 580 bytes which is definitely wrong.
# It is difficult to see the recent events when they show up below the readme file for a repo In the case of a kernel, the readme file is small. Perhaps this should show up below the comments, or be user configureable.
# I have 2 other repos that have been doing an 'import' since friday. There is no way to cancel the import since they seem to have stalled. If they are too big, please let me know.\\
Could someone please take a look at these issues?
fields.summary: strange behaviour

fields.summary: Having trouble cloning repository

fields.description:
Hi,

The currently deployment key is read only for the entire repository. It would be better if we can define it for specific branches of the repository.

I typically have a "release" branch that I want this deployment key to have access to. It should not have access to my "master", "experimental", etc branches.

This is especially useful when we use deployment tools such as Capistrano to deploy our code to a live production environment but allow us to restrict read only access to only a specific branch instead of the entire repo.
fields.summary: Read only for branch for deployment (BB-7284)

fields.description:
Hi there,

I was trying to trouble shoot a corruption in my repository, I thought i had sorted it and did a force push.

Now the commit seems inaccesible? Could you have a look at why, it is number c4e2372

Thanks
fields.summary: Corrupt repository?

fields.description: then it would be possible to write a plugin for creating pull requests form command line
fields.summary: add api method that allows to create pull request for a repo

fields.description:
I would like to be able to have sortable tables on the wiki.  Wikimedia format allows for this.

It does not appear that markdown, creole, restructuredtext or textile allow for these types of tables.

Alternatively, it would be nice to choose the markup wikimedia uses.

h2. wikitable with sort##
[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:Table|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:Table]

{code}
#!wikimedia

{| class="wikitable sortable" border="1"
|+ Sortable table
|-
! scope="col" | Alphabetic
! scope="col" | Numeric
! scope="col" | Date
! scope="col" class="unsortable" | Unsortable
|-
| d || 20 || 2008-11-24 || This
|-
| b || 8 || 2004-03-01 || column
|-
| a || 6 || 1979-07-23 || cannot
|-
| c || 4 || 1492-12-08 || be
|-
| e || 0 || 1601-08-13 || sorted.
|}

{code}
fields.summary: Sortable tables for wiki (BB-7251)

fields.description: Hello, I think it's nice if a repository administrators can change the label of the issues.
fields.summary: Add "rename label"

fields.description: For the API, it would be awesome if anonymous issue creation was allowed on repos where the issue tracker is public and anonymous issue creation is enabled. That way the API would reflect the site interface.
fields.summary: Issue API - Enable Anonymous Creation (If enabled)

fields.description:
there is no way to get a list of all open pull requests via the api

this would allow to write a jenkins plugin that build runs builds for pull requests
fields.summary: Pull Request API (BB-7094)

fields.description: it would be useful to get notifications in hipchat when pull requests are opened, comments posted and pull requests merged
fields.summary: send notifications to hipchat for pull requests (BB-7283)

fields.description:
If i have a wiki page  content 1 to 100 with http link with title i can view correctly, but it link page content is going more than 100 i can not view , it is displaying what ever type content in wiki page edit view page.

Please the attached wiki page issue file and solve the issue.
fields.summary: Wiki ordered lists render links incorrectly for items 101-200 (BB-7248)

fields.description: after i delete and recreate the zone url is 404 error
fields.summary: URL

fields.description:
hello,

I'd like to give a UX tip: please A/B test adding a "Pricing" or "Plans" link in the footer. if you make more revenue significantly after 2 months (I think it might!) you are welcome to give us a free account ;-)

Thank you

(PS: the pricing link in footer is a must have I can not find your pricing page without using search engine)
fields.summary: Small suggestion: add Pricing or Plans link (BB-7224)

fields.description:
I would love the ability to have an "Ignore whitespace" toggle on the popup side-by-side diff viewer.

Nowadays, we utilize the side-by-side diff to more clearly see what changed in a changeset or pull request. We love it. Great stuff. But sometimes we get a contribution from a boneheaded developer who decided to use his IDE's "format" functionality to format the code according to his personal preference, and this can make it very difficult for us to spot the actual changes in the file, as opposed to just whitespace changes.

Yes, the side-by-side diff viewer popup thingy does enable us to better see the whitespace changes than the standard diff output, but adding an Ignore Whitespace toggle would be absolutely wonderful.
fields.summary: Ability to ignore whitespace changes in the diffs (BB-11120)

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to send an email to all the users of private repository.  For example, to announce a release.

Each time I invite a user, I have to remember to add their email address to another list I maintain separately, since once they are in the repository access list, not only do I not have a way to email the list, I can't even see their email address anymore - it just shows their Bitbucket name.

It'd be nice if at least the email address didn't get "lost" and doubly nice if it was easy to either get the list of email addresses, or better yet, just send a note to the list.
fields.summary: send email to users of a repository (BB-7281)

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I decided to move from GitHub to BitBucket. And I used Import option to move repos from GitHub to BitBucket. For about an hour I see:

Repository unavailable\\
This repository is currently unavailable.

And I can't do anything. Unfortunately recently repos in GitHub were removed and I guess it could cause problems. So If you could remove all repos at Appetitas group I could recreate them (I still code code ofc :) ) and upload code.

Best regards
fields.summary: Github import

fields.description:
The Bamboo service does not work correctly when using a Plan Branch. When a commit is made to a branch, instead of triggering a build of the corresponding plan branch in Bamboo, the main plan is triggered instead.

The Bitbucket service needs to figure out which plan branch to build automatically based on the plan branch's source repository matching the current branch.
fields.summary: Bamboo service builds wrong branch (BB-7308)

fields.description:
When you have a file starting with empty lines the\\
web sourcebrowser doesn't display them - it shows\\
the first non-empty line as line 1, which makes all\\
the line numbers in that file wrong.

The raw view shows the newlines correctly.

I don't know if it's relevant, but this occured in an .sql\\
file.
fields.summary: File viewer doesn't display newline(s) at start of file. (BB-7280)
Please remove the dollar signs in front of  "Import an existing repository" code! (BB-7222)
Http 412 error when connecting to Bitbucket (BB-7267)

fields.description:
It seems that there is no way to easily link to other wiki pages using the new Markdown syntax, which is apparently now the default, even on new pages created within Creole-only wikis. Additionally, the documentation makes no reference to wiki-linking at all.

Ideally, it should work similarly to other Markdown-based wiki systems, such as the [one used on Sourceforge|http://sourceforge.net/p/allura/wiki/markdown_syntax/#md_ex_artlinks].

I attempted to try different methods, but none of them worked, outside of creating full URLs.

Wiki-linking is a very curious omission considering this is a Wiki system.
fields.summary: No support for wiki article links in Markdown wiki pages (BB-11432)

fields.description:
A while ago, a change was made to allow all the administrators and writers of a repository to view incoming data from a Pull Request. This change enabled team leads and such to have access to the incoming data, while not needing direct access to the source repository.

Recent requests have been made to change this behavior back for users who are using Bitbucket for university courses, so that other students cannot see each other's work being posted back to a master repository.

Having the ability to make this optional for a specific source repository may be a way to enable both practices to work.
fields.summary: Optionally make incoming data from Pull Requests private from users who don't have access to the source repository (BB-7213)

fields.description:
One of our users is reporting an HTTP error when trying to clone the osrf/gazebo error.

The users reports this interaction:

{code}
hg clone https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo gazebo
requesting all changes abort: HTTP
Error 400: Bad Request
{code}

The user reports this problem happening consistently from two locations (work and home).  The user can apparently clone other bitbucket repositories, including others from within the osrf organization, without trouble.

We (the developers) are unable to reproduce the problem manually, and our continuous integration doesn't encounter it, either.

More discussion in our Q&A forum:\\
http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/859/hg-clone-http-error-400-bad-request/

Any thoughts on what could be going on here?
fields.summary: User unable to clone osrf/gazebo repository

fields.description: Anonymous users that create issues should be able to stay up to date on their issue activity. An optional email input for anonymous issue creation would satisfy this.
fields.summary: Email option for anonymous users who submit issues (BB-7223)

fields.description:
Hi

I am committing to my repo with my tayfundoker account but bitbucket and JIRA sees it another user that i don't know. My team is adserver but the user which i dont know is Tayfun Gökmen Halaç. There is a confusion with names but how is it possible.
fields.summary: Security Problem

fields.description:
We I create a project, there is a little help how to add code to the repository:\\
(1) How to add code\\
(2) How to start from scratch

Usually the programmer has a code he want to add to the repository, and the commands to to that should be:

go to your computer\\
if you use linux start a terminal\\
if you have windows go to start/programs/git/git bash

Write this commands in gitbash (windows) or in bash(linux)

{code}
#!python

cd /path/to/your/project
example: cd /c/xampp/htdocs/myproject  
git init
git remote add origin sshkey
example: git remote add origin ssh://git@bitbucket.org/username/projname.git
git status
git add *
git status
git commit -m "This is the very first initial commit"
git status
git push origin master

{code}

Go to bitbucket and check the code is in the repository
fields.summary: More help in commands to start using git

fields.description:
Browser: chrome 24.0.1312.52 (OS X 10.6)

All pagination links load first page (results 1-30) when performing a (two word) search on the commits page of a repo.

# Go to a commits page of a repo.
# Search for a two word query (with no adv. help switches) that would produce more than one page of results.
# Use 2, 3, Next: the first set of results is loaded.

Note that the urls are changing (the hash changes) - but the page that loads is still the 'first' page.

This should be the second page of my commits on galaxy/galaxy-central:\\
[https://bitbucket.org/galaxy/galaxy-central/commits/all/17d6bfafebec/Carl%20Eberhard|https://bitbucket.org/galaxy/galaxy-central/commits/all/17d6bfafebec/Carl%2520Eberhard]
fields.summary: Pagination broken in commits page with search

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm trying to create an user on Bitbucket but an error appears after I fill the form and hit "Sign Up":

"Something went wrong."

I tried to create the user again with the same information, but now the system gives me a message that "A user with that username already exists.". Think I blocked this username on the system...

I typed other usernames (otavioaguiar, otaviodeaguiar, otavio_aguiar, otaviovbra, otaviorodriguesdeaguiar), but the same problem occurs. I already tried using a different email account and using OpenId to register.

Here is the last debug info of the error: 34c4cf6ebfc34f24b15c21b149230342$3fd912c8c43e6261d9c2d03b01fc6b9f .

I already checked my emails for Bitbucket messages, but none was received.

Thank you for the help.
fields.summary: Trying to create a new user with last name greater than 30 chars results in error (BB-7226)

fields.description:
Confirmation when setting close-'master'-branch in pull request. It is very easy to accidentally remove the master branch from a repo when working with pull requests.

Steps reproduce:

* Create a repo with two branches
* Create a pull request, merge from master to another branch
* Enable the option: "Close master after the pull request is merged"
* Create pull request
* Accept/merge pull request
fields.summary: Confirmation when setting close-'master'-branch in pull request

fields.description:
We have connected Bitbucket with Jenkins to deploy automatically when the repository is commited

Sometimes, the bitbucket configuration disappears.

The repository which has been removed the configuration is:\\
https://bitbucket.org/smartparkteam/9sp-backend-prod\\
[https://bitbucket.org/smartparkteam/9sp-backend-prod/admin/services]

Also we have equivalent configurations in other repositories. In some cases, we experimented same issues with other repositories.\\
https://bitbucket.org/smartparkteam/9sp-backend-pre\\
[https://bitbucket.org/smartparkteam/9sp-backend-pre/admin/services]

Regards
fields.summary: The Services configuration disappears

fields.description:
I couldn't find an issue about this, so here goes, my first try at reporting anything :)

h1. How it works currently
The folder name in a tag/branch tarball is $user-$repo-$node, for example.

I understand that the node ID is unique and specifies very well what the tarball contains, but as SHA hashes are by definition unpredictable, it's impossible to automate with them.  For example, in the distro I use and package for, there's a simple script that fetches the source, and of course it's a lot easier to specify a version string than something random.  Even other than automation, you extract something and get eg. xi-pyyaml-607628291e74/, how do you know later on, which of your xi-pyyaml-* directories is the one you want?

h1. What would be nicer
To solve this, I guess it would be better if tag downloads would contain instead the tag name (eg. xi-pyyaml-3.10), and it might also be useful if the branch downloads contained the branch name somehow too, though I'm not exactly sure about its usefulness.

Maybe for Hg repos where the local revision ID is defined (I know Git can't do this), *if* you approach the download from the revid, get a revid into the download's folder instead of the node.  Yes, it's not unique and precise, but public repos shouldn't be history edited anyway.  Still much more human-friendly than the random hash.
fields.summary: Download filenames should include the branch or tag downloaded, not the hash (BB-7263)

fields.description:
Hi,

When I open a  networkfile in the path including some Chinese characters. Orange-network report the  following info:

Unhandled exception of type TypeError occured at 14:13:55:\\
Traceback:\\
File: OWNxFile.py, line 402 in browseNetFile\\
Code: self.selectNetFile(0)\\
File: OWNxFile.py, line 152 in selectNetFile\\
Code: self.openFile(self.recentFiles[0])\\
File: OWNxFile.py, line 198 in openFile\\
Code: net = Orange.network.readwrite.read(fn, auto_table=self.auto_table)\\
File: readwrite.py, line 136 in read\\
Code: return read_pajek(path, encoding, auto_table=auto_table)\\
File: readwrite.py, line 243 in read_pajek\\
Code: input = orangeom.GraphLayout().readPajek(path, project)\\
TypeError: invalid arguments (a string and optionally a boolean expected)
fields.summary: open a  networkfile in the path including some Chinese characters

fields.description:
the request I have been making, as user developingchris

is\\
https://#{username}:#{password}@api.bitbucket.org/1.0/user/repositories/?query=sites_

now I get an empty list even though I have access to all of the repos in an org that used to show.

fields.description:
Currently, emails sent are not colored. That's quite a bumer for these mails' readability. Would be very much appreciated.\\
Thanks.
fields.summary: Email diffs with color (BB-16052)

fields.description: When viewing the list of commits on a repo, the dates on the right say things like "21 hours ago" or "26 days ago". You have to go back more than a month before you get a date. Can these be changed to be real dates and times? Like, "Sep. 21, 9am".
fields.summary: Give users a way to see absolute timestamp for commits, comments, PRs, etc. (BB-7246)

fields.description:
Having a problem when trying to create a new repository and it goes into an infinite loop.

Saw this issue resolved 20 days ago, seems like its not solved. Been waiting for almost 10 minutes already.
fields.summary: Infinite Loop creating new repository

fields.description:
In the previous design the issue tracker button had a dropdown menu that enabled user to create an issue quickly. That was very comfy, especially when you needed to create multiple issues in a row. Now i have to make more clicks - issues - create an issue, after creating an issue, i must go to issues one more time only to click "create issue" button.

Suggestions:\\
a) create a dropdown menu on issues, that will enable user to go to "create an issue" page instantly from any page\\
b) make a separate button for this in the menu\\
c) make a button "add another issue" that appears on the page that shows up after an issue was created
fields.summary: Suggestion: "create another issue" button (BB-7245)

fields.description: Clicking the button (on the destination repository pages) results in an "Access Denied" error message. This is confusing.
fields.summary: Create Pull Request button is enabled even if a user doesn't have write access to the repository (BB-7186)
